poem:
**Courtroom Mushrooms**

In Morwell's dim-lit court,  
three voices pen the spore—  
Garner, Hooper, Krasnostein—  
they breathe the tale's allure.  
Ink and whispers weave,  
each gavel's fall a seed—  
from fungal tapes sprout truth,  
beside myths of Greek and Thai,  
where every page sings  
a joyful, layered feast.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Mushroom tapes, erotic Greek myths and joyful Thai cooking: the best Australian books out in November The Mushroom Tapes by Helen Garner, Sarah Krasnostein and Chloe Hooper Nonfiction, Text Publishing, $36.99 One of the many tantalising details to emerge from the trial of Erin Patterson were reports that Helen Garner, Chloe Hooper and Sarah Krasnostein had been spotted in Courtroom Four at Morwell. Were there three works of Australian literary nonfiction about Erin Patterson in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
